problem_text:
Conjecture: Let G be a finite group, p a prime number, and P a Sylow p-subgroup of G. Suppose that an irreducible ordinary character χ of G has degree divisible by p. If the restriction χP of χ to P has a linear constituent, then χP has at least p different linear constituents.
This conjecture has been verified for symmetric, alternating, p-solvable, and sporadic simple groups.
E. Giannelli
